Remarks:  Because of the high content of surface area on ribs, the rub plays a big role in the flavor.  The lack of sugar in this rub allows one to cook the ribs over medium-high heat without burning.

Remarks:  The following comments were included in the newspaper article on traditional barbecue recipes.  “Barbecue sauce is probably the most overrated ingredient in barbecue cooking.  Truly great barbecue should be judged by the quality of the smoked meat, not the sauce.  The Cowtown Barbecue sauce recipe is a good basic sauce.”
Source:  Express News Cooking Section Special.
remarks: The Slaughterhouse and pork rubs, above, are designed for large cuts of meat.  Both rubs have a high percentage of sugar.  If one uses lower cooking temperatures then the amount of sugar may be increased and achieve a sweeter aftertaste.  Finally, white sugar and lemon pepper taste better with brisket while brown sugar and cumin go better with pork. Slaughterhouse Rib Rub
